help.title: **Help**
help.description: All commands below come with a description of what the command does and any available subcommands.

footer.text: To get additional help for a specific command, run "help <command>".

fields.name: init
fields.value: Initialises the guild calendar with a specific timezone.

fields.name: event
fields.value:
Create, update and delete calendar events.
Available subcommands: `list`, `update`, `delete`

fields.name: perms
fields.value:
Set role- or user-specific command permissions.
Available subcommands: `nodes`, `show`

fields.name: prefix
fields.value: View the bot's current prefix for your guild.

fields.name: settings
fields.value: Change the bot's prefix, timezone and channel settings.

fields.name: ping
fields.value: Pings the bot.

fields.name: info
fields.value: Get some information about the bot.

fields.name: Need more help? Did you find an issue with the bot?
fields.value: Run the `support` command to get an invite link to the support server and get in touch with the developer.

fields.name: Want to add the bot to your own server?
fields.value: Run the `invite` command to get an invite link for the bot.

init.title: **Help**: init
init.description:
Use this command to initialise the guild calendar with a specific timezone.
You **must** run this command first before you are allowed to create events.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage
fields.value:
`init <timezone>`
- `timezone` A timezone name from the tz database. See https://goo.gl/NzNMon under the TZ column for a list of valid timezones.
Examples:
`init America/Los_Angeles`
`init GMT`

event.title: **Help**: event
event.description: Create, update and delete events for your guild. The bot will notify you automatically when the event is about to start.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage: Creating events
fields.value:
`event <event details> [--desc <event description>] [--repeat <d|w|m>]`
- `event details` The details for your event. Simply type the details as how you would say it.
- `event description` An optional description for your event.
- `d|w|m` Specifies whether to repeat the event daily, weekly or monthly.
Examples:
`event CS Scrims 7pm-10pm`
`event Dota Tournament tomorrow 9a-6p --desc 32-man round-robin`
`event Weekly Discussion Jul 20 10am to 11am --repeat w`
`event Movie Outing next Saturday 9pm --desc Monthly movie-watching session --repeat m`

fields.name: Usage: Listing existing events
fields.value: `event list`

fields.name: Usage: Updating events
fields.value:
`event update <event number> [event details] [--desc <event description>] [--repeat <d|w|m|off>]`
- `event number` The number of the event that you want to update, which you can check with the `event list` command.
- `event details` The details for your event. Simply type the details as how you would say it.
- `event description` An optional description for your event.
- `d|w|m|off` Specifies whether to repeat the event daily, weekly or monthly, or turn repeat off.
Examples:
`event update 1 CS Scrims 7p-10p`
`event update 1 --desc Scrims vs amateur teams`
`event update 1 --repeat d`
`event update 1 CS:GO Scrims 7p-9p --desc Amateur scrimmages --repeat w`

fields.name: Usage: Deleting events
fields.value:
`event delete <event number>`
- `event number` The number of the event that you want to update, which you can check with the `event list` command.
Example:
`event delete 1`

perms.title: **Help**: perms
perms.description: Set command usage permissions for certain roles or users to limit command usage.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage: Modifying permissions
fields.value:
`perms <allow | deny> <permNode> [--role <role> | --user <user>]`
- `allow | deny` Allow or deny the specified permission node.
- `permNode` The permission node you want to modify. Run `perms nodes` for a list of nodes.
- `role` The role that you want to modify the permission for.
- `user` The user that you want to modify the permission for.
Examples:
`perms deny event.delete --role Normal Users`
`perms allow ping --user Andy`

fields.name: Usage: Listing available permission nodes
fields.value: `perms nodes`

fields.name: Usage: Showing current permissions
fields.value:
`perms show [--node <permNode> | --role <role> | --user <user>]`
- `permNode` The permission node that you want to show permissions for.
- `role` The role that you want to show permissions for.
- `user` The user that you want to show permissions for.
Examples:
`perms show --node ping`
`perms show --role Normal Users`
`perms show --user andy`

prefix.title: **Help**: prefix
prefix.description: View the bot's prefix for your guild.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage
fields.value: `prefix`

settings.title: **Help**: settings
settings.description: Change the bot's prefix, timezone and default channel settings.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Prefix setting
fields.value:
`settings prefix [new prefix]`
- `new prefix` The new prefix that you want to change to.
Examples:
`settings prefix` - displays the current prefix setting
`settings prefix ++` - change the prefix to `++`

fields.name: Default channel setting
fields.value:
`settings defaultchannel #new-channel`
- `#new-channel` The new default channel (as a mention) that you want to change to.
Examples:
`settings defaultchannel` - displays the current default channel setting
`settings defaultchannel #general` - change the default channel to #general

fields.name: Timezone setting
fields.value:
`settings timezone [new timezone]`
- `new timezone` The new timezone that you want to change to.
Examples:
`settings timezone` - displays the current timezone setting
`settings timezone Asia/Tokyo` - change the timezone to Asia/Tokyo
